content:
My name is Shishir Shakya. I am an Assistant Professor of Economics in the Department of Economics at the Shippensburg University of Pennsylvania.
Spring 2021, I am teaching Economic Analysis of Big Data (ECO 393), collaborating with DataCamp. I have taught Principles of Economics, Principles of Macroeconomics, Business Data Visualization, Elementary Business, and Economic Statistics.
My research interests include applied economics, health, energy, public/regional economics, applied machine learning, and data science. My research explores the U.S. health care policies, the opioid epidemic, and Medicaid.
Click these links for highlights:
 Prescription Drug Abuse Policy System - PDAPS.org put my “County-Level Assessment of Prescription Drug Monitoring Program and Opioid Prescription Rate” working paper in their resource.
 Scope of practice laws and the mobility of nurse practitioners published in Journal of Labor Research.
 The political economy of Vermontâ€™s abortion bill published in Applied Economics Letters
 Exploration into the causal relationship between institutional quality and startup density.
